basics.name: Hongyu Wu
basics.summary: PhD student in Computer Science at the University of Oklahoma advised by Yi Wu. Researching 3D perception across point clouds, language grounding, and foundation models.

work.summary: Open vocabulary fine-granularity segmentation in 3D scene.
highlights: Introduced a natural-language guided 3D part segmentation task and created a large-scale dataset with detailed part annotations.
Designed a two-stage search-localize pipeline that improves open-vocabulary 3D part and instance segmentation.

work.summary: Self-supervised point cloud augmentation with freeform deformation.
highlights: Developed learnable deformation modules and saliency-guided mixup for label-free 3D point cloud augmentation.
Achieved 93.7% accuracy on ModelNet40 and strong results across downstream tasks.

publications.name: Segment any 3D-Part from a sentence
publications.summary: Hongyu Wu, Pengwan Yang, Yuki M. Asano, Cees G. M. Snoek. Under review for AAAI 2026.

teaching.description: Supported instruction, grading, and discussions for the graduate-level Data Mining course.
